primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus intervenes in the chaos of the storm to reveal his divine identity and reconcile humanity to God through his substitutionary sacrifice.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus comes walking on the water to them.
He alone treads on the waves of the sea.
He bowed his head into the storm of divine justice.

object.identificatie: Reconciliation and Eternal Life (The Bread of Heaven)
tekstueel_bewijs: He came to bring us eternal life.
He came to reconcile us to God.
The storm of divine justice and wrath on our sin.
So you can be made whole.
So we could have peace with God.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as the helpless Receiver/Beneficiary.

tekstueel_bewijs: My body is going to be broken so you can be made whole.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the help through Christ.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the power of revelation.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and the 'Ultimate Storm' of Divine Wrath
tekstueel_bewijs: The problems of sin and death and alienation.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely a psychological fear but the ontological reality of alienation from God and the 'ultimate storm' of judgment.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response: relinquishing control and 'taking hands off' their life.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/surrender) is presented as a necessary response to the realization of the primary program (soteriology).

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus comes walking on the water.
He came to conquer sin and death.
He bowed his head into the storm.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: They were straining at the oars.
You must deal with me on your own terms.

voorbeelden: You must deal with me on your own terms.
They intended to come and make him king.
Helping us understand who Jesus is.
The key to understanding the meaning...
He has absolute power over them.
He’s going to be able to save us from storms.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on Christ's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to save where the human 'Pouvoir' is non-existent. It is a theology of Divine Capability.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the false peace of the crowd (~S2) to the terror of the storm (S2), then reveals how Christ takes S2 to bring the disciples to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Substitutionary: Christ enters the 'Contrary' (Judgment) so the Receiver can experience the 'Positive' (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The 'ultimate storm' is described as divine justice that would otherwise kill the sinner.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God/Christ is the primary actant. Human effort is deconstructed as a form of 'fighting God.'

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the Gerstner story
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: That night she took her hands off her life.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He came to conquer sin and death itself.
He bowed his head into the storm of divine justice... so we could have peace.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The story of the missionary girl is used as a negative/positive example of surrender, but it is subordinated to the work of Christ.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Jonah (as a type of Christ, not a moral model for us)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by making Christ the 'Ultimate Jonah' rather than telling us to be better Jonahs.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; moving from anxiety to 'smiling at the storm.'
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation: the boat reaches the shore 'immediately' upon Christ's entry.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.coherentie_beschrijving: The secondary program of ethics (surrender) is strictly a result of the primary program of Christ's identity and work.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He was thrown into the ultimate storm... so we could have peace.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on Christological endowment rather than explicit Pneumatology.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is described as a 'hostility' and 'alienation' that requires a divine death to solve.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by Christ's 'I Am' power. The hearer is correctly placed as the one in the boat who cannot row their way to safety.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it effectively counters the 'Devoir' of moralism.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The transition from 'knowing' (Savoir) to 'trusting' (Vouloir) is well-handled.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in Christocentric narrative structure. It successfully moves the hearer from a Subject-role (trying to row/control) to a Receiver-role (trusting the I AM).

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'I Am' repetition, Greimas shows that 'I Am' functions as the acquisition of Modal Competence (Pouvoir) that the disciples lack.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'ego eimi'; semiotics explains why that Greek phrase changes the entire actantial axis from Fear to Peace.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'storm' is not just a setting but a 'Heavy Opponent' that necessitates a 'Subject-Switch' from the Disciples to Christ.

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (walks, comes, says, saves, bows head)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Jonah' typology to solidify the substitutionary actantial structure.
